meanings.definition: To transmit (a program or information) by radio or television.
meanings.sent1: The radio station broadcasted the weather report to everyone in the city.
meanings.sent2: The news channel broadcasted the breaking news to viewers around the world.
meanings.sent3: The comedian broadcasted jokes that had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her smile broadcasted happiness to everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse broadcasted its light across the dark sea, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: To scatter (seeds) by hand or machine over a large area.
meanings.sent1: The farmer broadcasted seeds across the field to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: The gardener broadcasted flower seeds in the garden for a colorful display.
meanings.sent3: The children broadcasted candy across the room during the party.
meanings.sent4: The wind broadcasted leaves in all directions during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel broadcasted acorns around the forest for winter storage.
